document_title: Chronic tonsillitis: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
Signs of chronic tonsillitis are basically the same as general tonsillitis.(1)
According to MSc.BS.CKI Nguyen Thi Thuc Nhu, symptoms may include:
Foul mouth;; Fever;; Swallowing entanglement;; Tired;; Body ache;; Prolonged cough;; Green or yellow phlegm may be mixed with blood;; Sore throat;; Hoarseness or loss of voice;; Snoring, sleep apnea syndrome.
Chronic tonsillitis can also cause tonsil stones. This is because saliva, dead cells, and food accumulate in the interstices of the tonsils. Over time, that debris clumps together, forming small pebbles that can cause bad breath. Tonsil stones can fall off on their own, but may also require a procedure to remove.
In addition, the manifestations of chronic tonsillitis are also specific by the long duration of the disease. While acute tonsillitis symptoms usually last only from 3 days to about 2 weeks, chronic tonsillitis produces symptoms that last more than 2 weeks and can recur many times a year.
Chronic tonsillitis can also affect the lingual tonsils, located in the lower part of the tongue, and inflame the accompanying nasopharyngeal structures.
In addition, untreated chronic tonsillitis often causes tonsil abscesses. This is a dangerous complication of chronic tonsillitis.
Tonsillitis can cause fever, sore throat, fatigue...
